
_decoded_content.title: Add "`meltano.yml` reference" doc
_decoded_content.description: The `meltano.yml` format is not currently documented, and can only be figured out by a user using trial-and-error and watching how commands such as `meltano add`, `meltano add --custom`, and `meltano config <plugin>set` affect the file.

_decoded_content.title: Add documentation error pages
_decoded_content.description:
### Problem

Documentation URLs break occasionally because of structural updates and more.

For example, see https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/merge_requests/953, https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/merge_requests/967, https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/merge_requests/1001, https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/merge_requests/1051, https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/merge_requests/1058, etc.

This can be automatically fixed or proactively detected in a pipeline as described in https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/issues/1162 or more specifically in https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/issues/1162#note_234380665 using the [`vuepress-plugin-check-md`](https://github.com/ulivz/vuepress-plugin-check-md) plugin.

However, even if when such broken URLs can be automatically detected and resolved, external sources will continue to use deprecated or broken links.

### Proposal

At the moment, documentation error pages (_Not found_) rely on the hosting provider and the basic [Not Found](https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/blob/6427d6bf050fe73383f0b7ef5fda6e6b1efb21ed/docs/src/.vuepress/theme/views/NotFound.vue) view added in VuePress.

| Not Found page on `meltano.com` | Not Found page on `localhost:8080` |
| ------ | ------ |
| ![error1](/uploads/a6be271177bdbc8f8053d4d90cb5fc70/error1.png) | ![error2](/uploads/4dcfb0e8d14edb6b9d59d5d357539dd3/error2.png) |

#### Plan
1. Override the error page on the hosting provider and use the custom _Not Found_ view.
2. Update the _Not Found_ view and include some useful links.

### Design

TBD

### Benefits

This could improve content discoverability, decrease bounce rate, and more.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description:
As a start, I think it would be good to prioritize based on:
- urgency of getting feedback
- relative implementation difficulty
- symbiotic relationships between issues

_decoded_content.title: Add support for clean documentation URLs
_decoded_content.description:
### Problem

Currently, documentation URLs append the `.html` suffix by default. This is how VuePress works out of the box.

This makes the URLs a) longer and b) more prone to error.

### Proposal

Let's add [`vuepress-plugin-clean-urls`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/vuepress-plugin-clean-urls) which is an official VuePress plugin to support for clean urls.

For example, see some before and after links:
- https://meltano.com/docs/command-line-interface.html (Before)
- https://meltano.com/docs/command-line-interface (After)
- https://meltano.com/docs/installation.html (Before)
- https://meltano.com/docs/installation (After)

### Benefits

This will make URLs shorter which will also benefit the CLI user experience and less prone to error.

### Risk

1. As mentioned in the plugin [documentation](https://vuepress.github.io/en/plugins/clean-urls/) this could require a small [configuration change](https://docs.netlify.com/routing/redirects/redirect-options/#trailing-slash) in the deployment environment.
2. The recent refactor of the docs in https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/merge_requests/995 could require more configuration for this.
3. By default, the Markdown extension for VuePress supports [redirecting to clean links](https://vuepress.vuejs.org/guide/markdown.html#redirection-for-urls) which will help not break any existing link.

### Next steps
Once this is done, let's plan to replace links in docs, CLI, app, etc.
